instruction.instructionnorm: To complete the activity, select each item and then select the corresponding category. Replay this interaction as many times as you need. There is no time limit. Your responses will not be graded.

draggableitem.item: Student used three different greetings when answering the phone at work.
Student useds eight emojis during a five-minute text message conversation.
Student seemed more reserved when speaking with family than in other settings.
Student often uses phone as a sign of disengagement.
I counted four grammatical errors in student's email to the professor.
Student’s use of profanity changed when they started losing the game.
Student seems comfortable using scientific jargon.
Analysis of student’s tweets reveals 20% are about school, 50% about work, and 30% about friends.
Student’s tone on the phone was friendlier early in the shift than it was later in the shift.
Student’s FaceTime calls averaged 15 minutes during the past week.

dataset.feedbackcor: Correct! You’ve matched each type of research data to its category. You understand that qualitative data includes subjective information based on observations and quantitative data can be replicated in a controlled environment.
dataset.feedbackincor: Incorrect. Try again. Refer to Chapter 15 to review the differences between qualitative and quantitative research data.
